thread.title: Longtime horse racing commission leader ousted
thread.title_full: Longtime horse racing commission leader ousted

title: Longtime horse racing commission leader ousted
text:
Longtime horse racing commission leader ousted By - Associated Press   
INDIANAPOLIS (AP) - The Indiana Horse Racing Commission has ousted its longstanding executive director as state officials look for new ways to promote the sport, which has declined in popularity. 
Chairman Thomas Weatherwax says the five-member commission voted Saturday to dismiss Executive Director Joe Gorajec. 
Weatherwax told the Indianapolis Business Journal that commissioners felt Gorajec was too focused on enforcing regulations and did not pay enough attention to marketing and promotion of horse racing. 
Commissioners, who are appointed by Republican Gov. Mike Pence, will now launch a national search for a replacement. Gorajec’s assistant will fill the role in the meantime. 
Weatherwax said nearby states like Ohio have done a better job of promoting the sport. He said the next executive director will focus more on “economic development.”
